JRMp3MediaObject Class Reference

Detailed Description

Mp3 object to be included in a post to a user's stream.

Create an mp3 media object, fill in the object's fields, and add the object to the JRActivityObject.media array in your JRActivityObject. How the mp3s get presented and whether or not they are used, depend on the provider.

Each mp3 must contain an NSString* src url, which is the URL of the MP3 file to be rendered. The mp3 can also include a title, artist, and album. The src URL must be well-formed; that is, it must have both a scheme and host, and conform to RFC 2396.

Note:
You can only include one JRMp3MediaObject in the media array. Any others will be ignored.
See also:
Format and rules are identical to those described on the Facebook Developer page on Attachments.

Member Function Documentation

- (id) initWithSrc: (NSString *)  src  

Returns a JRMp3MediaObject initialized with the given src.

Parameters:
src The URL of the MP3 file to be rendered. This value must be an NSString* representation of a well-formed URL, with a scheme and host. It cannot be an empty string or nil
Returns:
A JRMp3MediaObject initialized with the given src. If src is malformed, empty, or nil, returns nil

Properties

- (NSString*) src [read, assign]

The URL of the MP3 file to be rendered.

- (NSString*) title [read, write, copy]

The title of the song.

- (NSString*) artist [read, write, copy]

The artist.

- (NSString*) album [read, write, copy]

The album.
